title: Standard Form
text: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows: $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$
speech: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows:  f of x is equal to a, parentheses x minus h,  squared plus k
pacedSpeech: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows:   f of x is equal to a,  x minus h,  squared plus k

title: Finding $$h$$
text: We can find $$h$$ by using the formula $$\frac{-b}{2} a$$. $$\frac{6}{4}=\frac{3}{2}$$. $$h=\frac{3}{2}$$
speech: We can find  h  by using the formula , fraction, negative b, over 2,  a .  6 fourths is equal to, 3 halves .  h, is equal to 3 halves
pacedSpeech: by using the formula  , fraction, negative b, over 2,  a

title: Finding k
text: We can substitue $$x=h$$ into the general form of the quadratic to find k. $${2\left(1.5\right)}^2-6\left(1.5\right)=k=-4.5$$
speech: We can substitue  x is equal to h  into the general form of the quadratic to find k.  2 times 1.5 squared minus 6 times 1.5 is equal to k is equal to negative 4.5
pacedSpeech: We can substitue   x is equal to h
into the general form of the quadratic to find k.   2 times 1.5 squared minus 6 times 1.5 is equal to k is equal to negative 4.5

title: Rewriting into Standard Form
text: Using the values of a, $$h$$, and k derived in the previous steps, we can write the equation in standard form. $$f(x)={2\left(x-1.5\right)}^2-4.5$$
speech: Using the values of a,  h , and k derived in the previous steps, we can write the equation in standard form.  f of x, is equal to 2 times, parentheses x minus 1.5,  squared minus 4.5
pacedSpeech: Using the values of a,   h
, and k derived in the previous steps, we can write the equation in standard form.   f of x, is equal to 2 times,  x minus 1.5,  squared minus 4.5
